programme.desc: 2/10. Skipinnish perform Coire Bhreacan in front of thousands of fans at a concert celebrating 25 years of the band, from Edinburgh Castle.

programme.title: Alba Today

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: Sealladh ùr bho Alba. A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: 14/26. A new train that goes directly to the ocean has just opened in town. Célestine would love to go to the sea with Ernest, but the ticket is very expensive.

programme.title: Meaban is Moo
programme.desc: 6/10. Tha Meaban is Moo a' peantadh rudan gorm. Meaban and Moo are painting blue things.

programme.title: Boban is Fuigheag
programme.desc: 31/40. Tha Boban deis 'son a leabaidh ach chan e sin do dh'Fhuigheag! Boban is ready for his bed but the same cannot be said for Fuigheag!

programme.title: Boban is Fuigheag
programme.desc: 32/40. 'S fìor thoil le Fuigheag a bhith ga ruag is tha e fàs cho math air falach cuideachd! Fuigheag loves to be chased and he is getting good at hiding, too!

programme.title: Gasta a' Ghraineag/Happy the Hoglet
programme.desc: 7/26. Tha na sgòthan glas, greannach is gearaineach an-duigh. The clouds are grey, grumpy and out of sorts today.

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: 20/20. Tha Muireall 'g iarraidh a dhol suas ann am bailiùn airson cuairt-adhair. Muireall wants to go in a balloon for a trip up in the sky.

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: 13/20. Pàdraig MacAoidh a' leughadh Mar a Bhios tu nad Lochlannach. Peter Mackay reads Mar a Bhios tu nad Lochlannach.

programme.title: Clann Na Cruinne
programme.desc: 11/13. Tha Ada airson teachdaireachd chudromach innse tro bhith còcaireachd le stuthan sònraichte. By making and sharing food that would normally be wasted, Ada conveys a vital message.

programme.title: Flix
programme.desc: 4/13. Tha Là Nàiseant' nan Con ann is tha Flix airson a chomharrachadh. It's National Dog Day and Flix wants to celebrate it.

programme.title: Bogaisean is...
programme.desc: ...Gumbalan/Bottersnikes and Gumbles. 18/52. Chan eil cuimhne ro mhath aig Bonns is Troig an-diugh. Bonns and Troig don't have very good memories today.

programme.title: Stri
programme.desc: 8/12. Fiach a' farpais an aghaidh preasantairean CBBC ALBA. Fiach competes against the CBBC ALBA presenters.

programme.title: A' Chùil
programme.desc: 12/14. Tha Choirstaidh a' cruthachadh dominothan a ghabhas ithe agus deoch-bhainne anns A' Chùil. Choirstaidh is making dominoes you can eat and a milkshake.

programme.title: An Là

programme.title: SWPL - Hibernian v Glasgow City
programme.desc: SWPL action from Meadowbank stadium in Edinburgh as Hibs face Glasgow City in a top-of-the-table clash. Presented by Micheal Steele alongside Debbi McCulloch.

programme.title: Binneas - Na Trads
programme.desc: 4/8. Molaidh ciùil do Joe Aitken, clàraichte aig Duaisean nan Trads, 2024. A musical tribute to Joe Aitken, recorded at the Trad Awards in 2024.

programme.title: Faodail: Found
programme.desc: 2/4. The Faodail Film Archive celebrates lost indigenous films and showcases them to communities across the Outer Hebrides.

programme.title: Dàna | Scotland's Wild Side
programme.desc: 4/4. Coinneach Rankin ventures to Shetland with a friend to experience some of the most remote climbing in Britain.

programme.title: Transatlantic Sessions: Dluth an Daimh
programme.desc: 1/6. Fans of the 'Sessions' can see performances from James Taylor, Kathy Mattea, Dougie MacLean, Ricky Skaggs as well as the late Nanci Griffith.

programme.title: Leonardo da Vinci - Deisciobal...
programme.desc: ...an Eòlais/The Disciple of Experience. 2/4. Leonardo joins Duke Sforza's court and paints a monumental fresco.

programme.desc: 14/26. Fox and Hare are throwing a costume party. But who is the mysterious guest in ghost costume?

programme.title: Abadas
programme.desc: 9/26. Ben sends the friends in search of a very special kind of horse - a rocking horse. Seren soon discovers that this is also a very fun word to find!

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: 11/52. Tha AH-AH a' dol 'son sgrìob fhada is tha a charaidean uile 'son comhairle a thoirt dha. AH-AH is going for a trek and his friends all want to give him their words of wisdom.

programme.title: Cleasan Ataidh & Tilidh/The...
programme.desc: ...Adventures of Abney & Teal. 8/52. Teal and Neep help Abney find something to fill a gap on his shelves. Nothing seems to fit until they find an old radio in the lake.

programme.title: Pompon Am Mathan Beag/Pompon Little Bear
programme.desc: 23/39. Tha dragh air Pompon gun dìochuimhnich Rita mu dhèidhinn fhad's a bhios e air falbh. Pompon is worried that Rita will forget about him while he's away.

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: 14/20. Suzie Roberts reads Earball Katinka, written and illustrated by Judith Kerr and translated into Gaelic by Jo MacDonald.

programme.title: An Doimhne/The Deep
programme.desc: 1/13. Tha Na Neachdan airson dìomhaireachd a' chuain a shaoradh. The Neachdan family try to unlock the secrets of the sea.

programme.title: Facal Gaidhlig CBBC ALBA
programme.desc: Calum Dòmhnallach le taghadh de na faclan Gàidhlig a b' fheàrr a chòrd ris fhèin. Calum Macdonald introduces a selection of his favourite Gaelic words.

programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pol...
programme.desc: ...Ploc/The Rubbish World of Dave Spud. 51/52. Lil Sue turns into a stomping, green eyed monster.

programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pol...
programme.desc: ...Ploc/The Rubbish World of Dave Spud. 52/52. According to Gareth the starfish, every pancake has two sides, happy and grumpy.

programme.title: Mach à Seo!
programme.desc: 5/8. Ramsay is in the Borders on a cycling holiday, the perfect escape from busy city streets. Ramsay is am baidhseagail air chuairt sna Crìochan, fada nas fheàrr na sràidean baile mòr.

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: 26/26. Joy Dunlop has a familiar visitor in the studio and Calum Maclean is at Glen Affric National Nature Reserve to examine its heroic work - and this time he has company!

programme.title: An Là

programme.title: Port an t-Òib
programme.desc: 2/6. We join Kenny Campbell on his new boat, fishing out of Leverburgh, and Neilly Maclean, who is sheltering from adverse weather.

programme.title: Leonardo da Vinci - An...
programme.desc: ...Cruthadair - Pàirt a h-Aon/Painter-God - Part 1. 3/4. Leonardo works as a military engineer and designs fanciful flying machines.

programme.title: Skipinnish aig a' Chaisteal (Shorts)

programme.title: Cuirm aig Celtic Connections | Valtos & Caraidean
programme.desc: 2/3. Valtos and friends in concert for Celtic Connections. Presented by Megan MacLellan.

programme.title: Eòrpa/European Current Affairs
programme.desc: 8/16. Shona MacDonald hears allegations of hundreds of wild sheep being allowed to starve to death every year on St Kilda.

programme.title: Cocain is na Klondykers
programme.desc: 3/3. Documentary series investigating one of the biggest drug seizures in Scottish history. Contains some strong language.

programme.title: Binneas - Na Trads

programme.title: The Orson Welles Story: Arena

programme.desc: 1/6. Documentary series celebrating Britain's rich industrial heritage, presented by Fred Dibnah. This programme examines the early use of wind and water power.

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Exploring how Britain's expanding rail network sparked a social revolution. How do you organise a network in a country of separate time zones and no recognised timetables?

programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Arianna Stassinopoulos, Richard Baker and David Attenborough. With guest musician Erich Leinsdorf.

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin investigates the dramatic life of the oak tree - a species that makes extraordinary transformations as it meets the challenges of the four seasons.

programme.title: Dead Man's Shoes
programme.desc: (2004) Shane Meadows' thriller starring Paddy Considine, Gary Stretch and Toby Kebbell. An ex-soldier is bent on revenge against the drug dealers who cruelly tormented his younger brother.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: (1993) Anthony Hopkins stars in this subtle drama about the dedicated butler of a post-WWI home whose loyalties are tested when the housekeeper (Emma Thompson) falls in love with him.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: (1955) A non-stop romp of a western from director Joseph H Lewis. In the town of Medicine Bend, only Marshal Calem Ware can keep its citizens from falling into complete lawlessness.

programme.title: The Blue Lamp
programme.desc: (1950) Gritty noir thriller from Ealing Studios. A rookie PC hunts a vicious killer across blitz-battered London. With Jimmy Hanley, Dirk Bogarde and Jack Warner as PC George Dixon.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1956) Historical drama. The Oscar-winning Ingrid Bergman stars as an amnesiac refugee who Yul Brynner tries to pass off as the daughter of the murdered Tsar of Russia, Nicholas II.

programme.title: The Old Man and the Gun
programme.desc: (2018) Crime biopic. Robert Redford stars as charming 74-year-old robber Forrest Tucker. He's still robbing banks when he falls for farmer Jewel (Sissy Spacek). But the cops still want him.

programme.title: Tombstone
programme.desc: (1993) Western. Kurt Russell stars in the story of legendary Wild West lawman Wyatt Earp told through the medium of the moustache. With Val Kilmer as 'Doc' Holliday and Charlton Heston.

programme.title: On the Come Up
programme.desc: (2022) Jamila Gray stars as Lil' Law'- a struggling young rapper who wants to make her fortune to help her family in director Sanaa Lathan's hip-hop-battling-coming-of-fame drama.

programme.title: Climax
programme.desc: (2018) Hallucinogenic thriller. Dancers gather in a deserted building. But the sangria's spiked. In French/subs.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Payroll
programme.desc: (1961) British crime thriller starring Billie Whitelaw. When Jackie's husband - an armoured van driver - is killed in a heist, she vows to unmask those responsible and take her revenge.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: (1950) Western. John Wayne plays the commander of a Texan fort at which his ex-wife (Maureen O'Hara) pitches up. Can he win back her love by saving kidnapped children from Apache raiders?

programme.title: Ten Tall Men
programme.desc: (1951) Comedy adventure. Burt Lancaster stars as a Foreign Legion sergeant leading nine men on a dangerous mission to prevent a Berber attack on a North African desert fort.

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: (2004) Drama. Dennis Quaid stars as the captain of an aircraft downed in the desert. There's no hope of rescue, unless he and the survivors can build another plane from the wreckage.

programme.title: Deadpool 2
programme.desc: (2018) Ryan Reynolds returns as the potty-mouthed, can of whup-ass-opening superhero and now he's got buddies to help him take on baddie Josh Brolin in the all-out action comedy sequel.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: The Outsiders
programme.desc: (1983) Francis Ford Coppola's seminal brat pack coming-of-age crime drama with Tom Cruise, Patrick Swayze, Ralph Macchio, Matt Dillon and Rob Lowe. Two teenage tribes go to war in Tulsa.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Pool of London
programme.desc: (1951) Bonar Colleano stars in this thriller, as a sailor who police think's a killer. Has he been set up? He goes on the run. Will police find him? Are his days done? #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: Nothing But the Best
programme.desc: (1964) British comedy with Denholm Elliott and Alan Bates. Jimmy hopes to change when he and Charles become mates, as Charles teaches him how to be one of the greats. #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: (1966) Comedy with a stellar cast. With dosh going to the one who dies last. Who will get the cash? As both brothers clash. Wanting their parents' money fast. #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: The Frogmen
programme.desc: (1951) Richard Widmark stars as a frogman, whose team really aren't this frogman's fan. But when a torpedo hits the sick bay, can frogman Richard save the day? #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: Dante's Peak
programme.desc: (1997) Volcanologist Pierce Brosnan warns a town of a coming eruption. But the locals won't evacuate; they don't want the disruption. #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: See How They Run
programme.desc: (2022) Comic whodunnit set amid a play. A director's been killed and the body's going stiff. Can two cops solve it? With Sam Rockwell, Saoirse Ronan and Reece Shearsmith. #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: Knives Out
programme.desc: (2019) Quirky whodunnit with Daniel Craig as Benoit Blanc, an eccentric detective. A rich man's been killed and everyone has a motive, so Benoit must be extra perceptive. #NationalPoetryDay

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: (1985) Thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. To free his kidnapped daughter, an ex US commando must agree to assassinate a South American president. But he's not as pliant as he seems...

programme.desc: Amy's attempts to mediate between Harry and Bobby end in a row. Ella hopes her friendship with Kelsey isn't beyond repair, and there's a double date for two fledgling romances.
